More Details
Preventation
7.Do not kill snake in the wild,Throwing rocks at a snake or shooting at them is looking for trouble
PREVENTATION OF SNAKE BITE

Many of Tanzanian are out door and spend a great deal of their time fishing ,hiking ,farming or just herding their livestock. Confrontation with snake are therefore rather common . Here are the few suggestion on how to avoid snakes and snakebite
1.Leave snake alone
2.If you are in the veld , wear stout shoes or boots (not sandals) and long trousers , preferably denims.Most victim are bitten on lower or ankle,often when they accidentaly stand yon a snake.
3.Do not walk barefoot at night in a veld.if you have to move around in the dark , take along touch to light your way

4.Keep your eyes open and look where your going .when mountain climbing don’t put your hands in a piace that are out of sight .when collecting fire woods ,don’t reach into holes ,burrows and hollow logs
5.Do not steps over logs and large rocks ,as a snake may be sunning itself on the opposite side Rather sted onto such object
6.If you do come close a snake .Stand perfectly still .No snake will come and attack you .if your far distance from a snake stay 4 m or more ,retreat slowly .snake do not chase people .
8.Do not temper with seemingly dead snake ,as some of them feign dead .The body my be turned sideways or upside down while the tongue hang out bewa.re
9. Treat all snakes with respect
10. In order to keep snake away from sure environment around houses are tied up and free from students and all sort of pest because all that attract snakes to live near or in human settlement
Venom Type And spicies
1.Haemotoxic
1.Cytotoxic
1.Neurotoxic
VENOMS
These can be classified as follows;
1.Haemotoxic : (boomslang ,Vine snake(Eastern and savana)), causing bleeding due to a coagulation defect
Dominant clinical presentation of victim -> Bleeding(B)
First Aid ->: Suction or nil
Suportive Treatment ->: Blood or blood component therapy
Antivenom may be necessary for threat to limb or life ->: Bloomslang]>
Antivenom Type->: Bloomslang monospecific
Sugested dose by intravenous injection ->: 10-20 ml]
Cytotoxic
Snakes species ->: Puff adder, Gaboon adder, spitting cobras (Mozambique,black-necked, black, zebra)
These can be classified as follows;
Snakes species ->: Puff adder, Gaboon adder, spitting cobras (Mozambique,black-necked, black, zebra)
Cause extensive painful swelling around the site of the bite with possible tissue destruction, Bleeding may occur in puff adder
First Aid ->: Suction or nil
Suportive Treatment ->: intravenous fluids Elevate bitten limb
Antivenom may be necessary for threat to limb or life ->: Puff adder and spitting cobras, Gaboon adder
Sugested dose by intravenous injection ->: 50 ml puff adder and spitting cobras and 200ml Gaboon adder
Antivenom Type->: Polyvalent]
Neurotoxic
(cobras,mambas (green and black), non spitting cobras) -> causing paralysis of the muscles including those requid for swallowing & respiration.

First Aid – >: Sunction oil . Non spitting cobras : preasure immobilization or arterial tourniquet. Mambas : arteriaj tourquet.Polyvalent antivenoms for the triad of perioral Artificial respiration may be necessary
Supportive treatment->: Oxgen by mask or ventilation,Protect the airway
Antivenom may be necessary for threat to limb or life->: All spicies
Antivenom type->: Polyvalent
80 ml (40 – 200ml) small doses may lead to a recurrence of symotoms
*Sunction is of minimal benefit but reassuring to the patient.
*Some authorities prefer keeping the bitten limb at heart level
*Polyvalent antivenom is effective against the bites of the mambas ,cobras,puff adder and Gaboon adder. A test dose of antvenom is not indicated
